description:
Fudo Jun is a beautiful supermodel who is idolized by many. She also has a dark secret that not even she knows about at first, for within her veins run the genes that hold the next step in the evolution of mankind. The same blood as the beastlike superhumans that terrorize the city. Unlike the rest of them, though, Jun has managed to hold a tenuous grip onto her humanity, and she is recruited by the mysterious Asuka Ran, member of a secret organization within the government, aimed at controlling, if not eliminating, these berserk destroyers of mankind. Jun, as Devilman Lady, must now exterminate her own kind, but how much longer can she keep her sanity in a situation she never chose in the first place?

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

node.description:
__Hobbies:__ making ribbon bows and sweets, writing poems, Phantasy Star Online

[Website](http://www.tamurayukari.com) | [Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/tamura_yukari.html) | [Music Profile](http://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=15412) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yukari_tamura) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukari_Tamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E6%9D%91%E3%82%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialChannel-eu5sl)

She is a popular Japanese singer-songwriter and voice actress (seiyuu), currently affiliated with Amuleto (as seiyuu) and with King Records (as songstress). Affectionately called Yukarin by her fans, she is also known for her soft voice and interest in Lolita fashion. She made her debut as a voice actress in 1997, releasing her debut single Yuuki wo Kudasai on March 26, 1997.
While also a well-known seiyuu, several of her releases have been used as opening and ending themes for anime series, while some have reached the Oricon top 100 singles and album charts. Her role as Takamachi Nanoha in the Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha series contributed to a rise in her popularity, as several of her singles (Little Wish: Lyrical Step, Spiritual Garden, Hoshizora no Spica, Beautiful Amulet) were used as the ending themes for the franchise's anime adaptations.

Non-Anime Roles
- Nahida (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Qiqi (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Theresa Apocalypse (Honkai Impact 3rd) [VG]
- Vita Clotilde - The Legend of Heroes Series [VG]
- Yvette - Strinova [VG]
Worked for ADV Films and currently Funimation. He's an ADR Director, Recording engineer, and voice actor for numerous works.

Worked for ADV Films and currently Funimation. He's an ADR Director, Recording engineer, and voice actor for numerous works.

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_van_Beethoven)

Ludwig van Beethoven was a German composer and pianist.

Beethoven remains one of the most admired composers in the history of Western music; his works rank amongst the most performed of the classical music repertoire. His works span the transition from the classical period to the romantic era in classical music. His career has conventionally been divided into early, middle, and late periods. The "early" period, during which he forged his craft, is typically considered to have lasted until 1802. From 1802 to around 1812, his "middle" period showed an individual development from the "classical" styles of Joseph Haydn and Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, and is sometimes characterized as "heroic." During this time, he began to suffer increasingly from deafness. In his "late" period from 1812 to his death in 1827, he extended his innovations in musical form and expression.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Gianni Giuliano, born in Savona on January 16, 1948, is a renowned Italian voice actor, dubbing director, and actor.
After completing high school, he moved to Rome, graduated from the Silvio D’Amico Academy of Dramatic Arts, and embarked on a prolific career in theater and film.
He is married to actress and voice artist [Anna Leonardi](https://anilist.co/staff/327248/Anna-Leonardi).

__Members__

__Former Members__

KAKEL (Guitar) - Left in 2007.
LIKU (Drums) - Left in 2003.
LYO (Bass) - Left in 2002.

[Official Website](http://www.toshiyuki-watanabe.com/)

He is a composer and arranger who has scored several films and anime, most notably the Mothra films in the 1990s. He is the son of legendary tokusatsu and anime composer, [Chuumei Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/169740).

[Website](http://www.konaka.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamaki_nyx)

Chiaki J. Konaka is a Japanese writer and scenarist best known for shows such as [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Digimon Tamers](https://anilist.co/anime/874/) and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). He is also known to be the creator of Ultraman Gaia, as cited by Tsuburaya Productions.

Konaka's serious works generally have a dark, psychological tone. As a Cthulhu Mythos writer, he tends to add Lovecraftian elements to his works.

"Chiaki J. Konaka" is a very unusual name, as Japanese names typically do not include middle names. Konaka states that the "J." evokes the "Christian" name "John", due to him being born to parents who were members of the Anglican Church, but he does not identify as Christian. He began using the "J." at the age of 12, when he began making 8 mm films; he patterned the style after Western names such as "Charles M. Schulz".

He has cited [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) as his favorite screenwriting project.
__Ooishi Hiromichi__ is a Japanese producer and production manager, who also provides production supervision.
